page.title: 07THE LAURIE ARMS
page.content: The village pub is situated on the outskirts of Laurieston on the road to Gatehouse-of-Fleet.It is a new and attractive building .It was closed for a time in 1928 and re-opened in June 1978, with an extension built in 1981 In the summer months the times of opening are 11am until 11pm; in winter 11am until 2.30pm and 5pm until 11pm. In summer bar meals are available each day and approxmately 50-60 meals are prepared daily. The choice of menu includes soup, steak, steak pie, roast beef, scampi and chicken, all served with chipped patatoes, vegtables and salad. The sweets include ice cream, peach melba and meringue. In the pub extension darts and dominoes are played in winter. There is a pool table. There is live music. The pub is a meeting place for the locals and provides a happy atmosphere
